alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 5:25PM MDT until July 04 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Carbon County in south central Wyoming... Southern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 615 PM MDT. * At 525 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles north of Arlington to 9 miles south of Rock River to 12 miles north of Lake Hattie Reservoir to 9 miles south of Hutton Lake, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Laramie, Albany, Rock River, Bosler, Tie Siding, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Woods Landing-Jelm, Pumpkin Vine, Vedauwoo Campground, North Crow Campground, Nash Fork Campground, Boswell Creek Campground, The Buttes, Lake Owen, Hutton Lake, Arlington, Yellow Pine Campground, Tie City Campground, Vedauwoo and Brooklyn Lake. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 260 and 337. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. These are dangerous storms, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
